frame.name: Proportion
frame.definition:
<def-root><fen>Criteria</fen> exist that identify a particular <fen>Subset</fen> of a <fen>Group</fen> of things into members and non-members. In this frame, a comparative relationship is determined which indicates the size of the <fen>Subset</fen> relative to the larger <fen>Group</fen>, expressed as the <fen>Ratio</fen>.
<ex> Urban areas have> a <fex name="Descriptor">higher</fex> <fex name="Subset">teen</fex> <fex name="Criteria">suicide</fex> <t><fex name="Ratio">rate</fex></t> than rural areas. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Criteria
FE.definition: <def-root>A representation of the conditions upon which membership to a <fen>Subset</fen> of a <fen>Group</fen> is determined. <ex>This drug can reduce the <t>rate</t> <fex name="Criteria">of heart diseas</fex>e significantly in people over 50.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subset
FE.definition: <def-root>The members of a <fen>Group</fen> that fulfill particular <fen>Criteria</fen> to belong to a <fen>Subset</fen> of the <fen>Group</fen>. <ex>California has a high <fex name="Subset">divorce</fex> <t>rate</t> compared to other states.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition: <def-root>A general collection of entities which are judged against the <fen>Criteria</fen> to determine membership in a <fen>Subset</fen>. <ex><fex name="Group">Georgia's</fex> literacy <t>rate</t> is the highest in the world.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of how the Ratio compares to expectations. <ex>We see <fex name="Descriptor">similar</fex> crime <t>rates</t> in the two areas.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ratio
FE.definition: <def-root>The numerical representation of the size of the <fen>Subset</fen> relative to the size of the <fen>Group</fen>. <ex>New laws have raised crime <t>rates</t> <fex name="Ratio">by 5%</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a number comparing a quantity of something relative to a more general group
